page.title: 18Farming,Bathgate part 2
page.content: I had a talk with them and this is what I was told. One day I was chatting with them, while having a cup of tea. I asked them if there were many small farmsteads in this area and the answer was "No". This surprised me immensely as I thought they would be popular. I asked them why they moved to Ballencrief, to take up farming. I was told that when they were married they had a chance of a cottage in Ballencrief. They moved there and found fields full of weeds and rough grass, which only goats would eat. They took up the idea and started farming goats. Just out of curiousity I asked if they thought farming on a small time basis will be going on in 200 years time and they said "Yes, because more people are turning to small farms."
